greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest cube containing exactly n 3's.
comment: a(n)^(1/3) = A048368(n) is the index of the first occurrence of n in sequence A269243. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 21 2016
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..23
mathematica: Table[SelectFirst[Range[2100000]^3,DigitCount[#,10,3]==n&],{n,11}] (* The program uses the SelectFirst function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 24 2015 *)
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
ext: a(0) = 0 prefixed by _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 21 2016
